intro: Diospyros sandwicensis var. ovalis, commonly known as the ʻōhiʻa ʻai, is a rare Hawaiian species native to the island of Kauaʻi. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub characterized by its elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves that are dark green and glossy. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by edible, fleshy berries that are an important food source for native birds. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native range. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered critically endangered.
